title: typing username wrong creates new user
body:
hi there!

i ran in to a serious problem with my owncloud installation. each time i log in to the webbased side of owncloud with an ipad, it automaticly types my name with a capital letter, however, my username in owncloud is all lowercase. what happens when i log in with a capital letter in front of my username, is that al my files seem gone. but after digging around in my data folder, i noticed there was now another folder with the same username i have, but starting with a capital letter. the original folder, containing all my files, still sits there, but it is the content of the capital letter folder i get to see when i log in to the webbased version and webdav/clientsync

to solve it, i screwed around a lot in the config file etc, probably from blind panic :) , and after deleting the newer folder and changing the config.php datadir from a symlink sitting in my owncloud folder on the webserver, to the original datadir of the oc datafolder, wich i have placed on another drive. last night the same happend, but now i didn't have to change the datadir back to the symlink again, like i had to do last time. perpaps later today i will run in to a snag that will force me to do that after all.

anyway, i hope someone, probably and preferbly the one who can fix this, is able to make heads and tail from my post, or at least point me in the right direction. cause i think this qualifies as a serious problem.

thanks in advance

update:
i have uploaded a file to my owncloud folder on my system to see if syncing was affected by all of this, but the file went straight to the datadir on oc, the same was true for uploading via the webinterface. so i can only conclude that changing the datadir and telling config.php the original path, in stead of the symlink, to the datadir, is now somehow permitted. or am wrong? (sew me for not reading entire forum later)


now before you start asking me all sorts of questions, wich have been asked before, i suggest you read up on what i have posted on oc forum. that would save me the trouble of repeating myself. so here is the post:

http://forum.owncloud.org/viewtopic.php?f=23&t=15220&p=38941#p38941
